intro: Oresitrophe, commonly known as the common false flax, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Onagraceae. It is native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa, and includes several species that are often found in disturbed habitats such as roadsides and fields. The plants typically have slender, erect stems and small, showy flowers that are often pink or white in color. Oresitrophe species are annual or biennial herbs, and their seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to their widespread distribution. The genus is characterized by its unique floral structure and ecological adaptability.
